summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 2019 discussing the need to obtain a letter from the SDNY (Southern District of New York) to support victim compensation applications for Epstein victims. The chain references frustration over a recent event (likely Epstein's death) and coordination between FBI New York field office personnel and the FBI Victim Services Division.

persons.name: Cronin
persons.context: An OVS representative who indicates that a letter from a DA or AUSA stating they would have prosecuted if the case was brought timely could allow victim compensation coverage. Expresses anger about 'what happened over the weekend' (likely Epstein's death).

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Referred to in the email chain, possibly someone who can push a request to the SDNY (Southern District of New York) regarding a letter for victim compensation.

connections.description: The email chain suggests coordination is needed between OVS (Cronin) and the FBI/SDNY (Mike) to obtain a prosecutorial letter for victim compensation.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Referenced indirectly as 'what happened over the weekend' in an email dated August 12, 2019, which aligns with the date of Jeffrey Epstein's death in his jail cell on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Inquiry about victim compensation
events.description: An FBI agent from the New York Field Office emails an OVS representative (Cronin) to ask if Epstein victims can still apply for compensation even though they disclosed their abuse years after it occurred.

events.title: Internal FBI coordination for victim letter
events.description: A series of internal FBI emails discussing the need to follow up and obtain a letter from the SDNY to support victim compensation applications for Epstein victims.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively working on victim compensation applications for Epstein victims in the New York area as of September 2019.

A key requirement for victim compensation was a letter from a District Attorney or Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) stating they would have prosecuted the case if it had been brought in a timely manner.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination between the New York field office and the FBI Victim Services Division to obtain the necessary prosecutorial letter from the SDNY.
An OVS representative (Cronin) expressed anger about 'what happened over the weekend' in an August 12, 2019 email, which is a clear reference to Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The document indicates that some victims had only recently disclosed their abuse to authorities years after it occurred, prompting questions about their eligibility for compensation.
